prompt: <description><part\\_1> - Rectangular Prism with a Sloped Side The first part of the CAD assembly is a rectangular prism with a sloped side. The prism has a length of 0.75 units, a width of 0.25 units, and a height of 0.75 units. 1. **Create the coordinate system:** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. Set the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.25, 0.0]. 2. **Draw a 2D sketch:** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. **Create the sloped face (face\\_1):** Create a closed loop (loop\\_1) on the X-Y plane with the following lines: - line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.25] - line\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.25], End Point [0.5, 0.25] - line\\_4: Start Point [0.5, 0.25], End Point [0.5, 0.5] - line\\_5: Start Point [0.5, 0.5], End Point [0.25, 0.5] - line\\_6: Start Point [0.25, 0.5], End Point [0.25, 0.25] - line\\_7: Start Point [0.25, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.25] - line\\_8: Start Point [0.0, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. **Scale the 2D sketch:** Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. **Transform the 2D sketch to a 3D sketch:** Apply the coordinate system transformation (euler angles and translation vector) to the 2D sketch, resulting in a 3D sketch. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch:** Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z axis by 0.25 units using the "New Body" operation. The resulting part is a rectangular prism with a sloped side, fulfilling the description provided in the CAD assembly JSON.</description>

The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the length of the sides. Continue with remaining parts.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom. The top is slightly wider than the bottom. The object has a smooth surface and appears to be made of a reflective material. Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0 degrees along all three axes and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. Sketch 1. Begin with a new sketch on the X-Y plane. 2. Draw the first line from point [0, 0.5653] to point [0.1432, 0.5653]. 3. Draw the first arc starting from point [0.1432, 0.5653], midpoint at [0.3233, 0.6226] and ending at [0.5033, 0.5653]. 4. Draw the second line from point [0.5033, 0.5653] to point [0.6465, 0.5653]. 5. Draw the third line from point [0.6465, 0.5653] to point [0.6465, 0.75]. 6. Draw the fourth line from point [0.6465, 0.75] to point [0.0, 0.75]. 7. Close the loop and complete the sketch by drawing the final line from point [0.0, 0.75] back to point [0.0, 0.5653]. 8. Create a new loop on the Z-Y plane with a single arc. The arc should start from point [0.1432, 0.5653], midpoint at [0.3233, 0] and end at [0.5033, 0.5653]. 9. Project the previously created line [0.5033, 0.5653] to [0.1432, 0.5653] on this new loop. 10. Create a new loop on the Z-X plane with a single arc. The arc should have the same description as the one on the Z-Y plane. Extrusion 1. Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.6792 units. 2. Scale the extrusion by a factor of 0.75. 3. Set the operation to "create a new solid body". The final dimensions of this part should be: * Height: 0.6792 * Width: 0.75 * Length: 0.75</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: A rectangular prism with a pointed end Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system created in step 1. Step 5: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Step 6: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.0219 units (extrude_depth_towards_normal) to generate the 3D model of the part. Step 7: Determine the shape, length, width, and height The shape of the part is a rectangular prism with a pointed end. The length is 0.75 units, the width is 0.75 units, and the height is 0.0219 units. Note The resulting 3D model from this set of instructions should be a rectangular prism with a pointed end, with the specified dimensions. This is the first part of the CAD assembly and lays the foundation for subsequent parts to build upon. The part is extruded along the Z-axis, with the pointed end facing upwards.</description>

prompt: <description>**CAD Design Instructions:** **Part 1: Rounded Rectangular Base** 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and Translation Vector: (0.0268, 0.75, 0.0392). 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create a circle on the sketch with a center at (0.0536, 0.0536) and radius 0.0536. 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1071. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal direction with an extrusion depth of 0.75 and no extrusion in the opposite direction. **Part 2: Tapered Top** 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.75, 0.0). 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create six lines on the sketch as follows: * Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0464), End Point (0.0804, 0.0) * Line 2: Start Point (0.0804, 0.0), End Point (0.1607, 0.0464) * Line 3: Start Point (0.1607, 0.0464), End Point (0.1607, 0.1392) * Line 4: Start Point (0.1607, 0.1392), End Point (0.0804, 0.1856) * Line 5: Start Point (0.0804, 0.1856), End Point (0.0, 0.1392) * Line 6: Start Point (0.0, 0.1392), End Point (0.0, 0.0464) 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1856. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal direction with an extrusion depth of 0.1071 and no extrusion in the opposite direction. **Notes:** * The base of the cylindrical object is a round rectangular prism with a slight taper. * The top of the cylindrical object is also a round rectangular prism with a more pronounced taper. * The overall height of the cylindrical object is the sum of the heights of the base and top parts, plus the offset in the coordinate system. * The base part has a height of 0.1071, a width of 0.75, and a length equal to its width. * The top part has a height of 0.1071, a width of 0.1856, and a length equal to its width. * The offset of the coordinate system for the top part positions it correctly on top of the base part, with a slight overlap. * The overall height of the cylindrical object is 0.1071 + 0.1071 + 0.0392 = 0.2534.</description>
